intro: Dracocephalum kaschygaricum, commonly known as Karakorum bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
